title: Huawei Nexus 6 leak could be our best look yet at Google’s next smartphone | Trusted Reviews
description:
![huawei nexus 6
leak](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**There’s plenty of hype surrounding Google’s next Nexus smartphone, so leaks
are dropping by the dozen.**

The latest Nexus leak could be our best look yet at the much-rumoured [Huawei
Nexus 6 (2015)](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/huawei-
nexus-6-2015-release-date-rumours-news-specs-price), expected to launch later
this year.

Two images and a render have emerged purportedly showing off the handset in
close-up.

What’s more, they come courtesy of prolific – and oft-reliable – leaker
[OnLeaks](http://www.nowhereelse.fr/huawei-nexus-6-2015-photos-
prototype-109356/).

So, what are the most noteworthy bits of these leaked snaps?

The first is the metal chassis, which we’ve already heard rumoured, but can
now see in the flesh…or rather, aluminium.

It’s no surprise that Huawei is opting for that sort of build, as we’ve
already seen the smartphone manufacturer use metal casing on its own handsets,
most recently with the Huawei P8.

## Latest

  * [ ![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-reviews-placeholder-3.svg) Credit: Photo by Raúl Nájera on Unsplash 

### How to vote in the US midterms 2018: Alexa has the answer

](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/alexa-vote-us-mid-term-
elections-2018-3613635 "How to vote in the US midterms 2018: Alexa has the
answer")

  * [ ![Twitter Trump](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-reviews-placeholder-3.svg) Credit: @lgbtfeedla 

### Twitter gives users more power to report fakers, as purge continues

](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/twitter-is-giving-users-more-power-to-
report-fake-accounts-as-purge-continues-3613624 "Twitter gives users more
power to report fakers, as purge continues")

  *   * [ ![Amazon Echo Dot \(3rd Gen\) 1 hero](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

### Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to enable it

](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-enable-alexa-whisper-mode-
echo-3607478 "Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to
enable it")

  * 

Next up is the widely leaked fingerprint sensor, which appears to be
positioned on the rear of the device, just as we expected.

As such, the Nexus 6 (2015) will potentially be the first ever Nexus
smartphone to feature a fingerprint scanner.

The device is also expected to run on [Android 6.0
Marshmallow](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinions/android-m-features),
which offers standardised fingerprint sensor support. How convenient.

The device also looks reasonably slim, which fits with a previous leak that
pointed to a 6.6mm edge profile – that grows to 8.5mm in the middle, mind –
thanks to the curved chassis.

The handset is large compared to the hand holding it, which gels with rumours
that suggest it will feature a 5.76-inch display.

**Related:[Best Android Smartphones 2015](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best-
android-phones-1_round-up)**

The Huawei Nexus 6 is expected to launch this autumn, landing alongside a new
[LG Nexus 5 (2015)](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/lg-
nexus-5-2015-release-date-rumours-news-specs-and-price).

Google has yet to confirm any such details, so take this latest report with a
pinch of salt.

What would you like to see from a new Nexus smartphone? Let us know in the
comments.
